title: Job Vacancies at the O Lounge
content:
Ora Lagos (The O Lounge), is a premier hospitality and entertainment destination known for its exceptional customer service, vibrant atmosphere, and innovative experiences. We are seeking passionate, dedicated, and talented individuals to join our team and contribute to our mission of creating unforgettable moments for our patrons.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Waiter / Waitress

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Waiter/Waitress is responsible for providing exceptional guest service by taking orders, serving food and beverages, and maintaining a clean and welcoming dining environment.
	The ideal candidate is energetic, well-spoken, attentive to detail, and passionate about hospitality.


Key Responsibilities


	Greet guests warmly and professionally as they arrive
	Present menus, explain specials, and answer questions about food and beverages
	Take accurate food and drink orders and relay them to kitchen and bar staff
	Serve meals and drinks promptly, checking in with guests during their experience
	Ensure tables are clean, properly set, and maintained throughout the shift
	Upsell menu items and make recommendations to enhance the customer experience
	Process bills and payments efficiently, using the POS system
	Handle guest complaints calmly and professionally, escalating issues when needed
	Work closely with other floor staff to ensure smooth service delivery
	Adhere to hygiene, health, and safety standards at all times


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Speed and accuracy of order-taking and delivery
	Customer satisfaction and feedback
	Cleanliness and table readiness
	Upselling performance
	Team collaboration and punctuality


Skills & Qualifications


	Prior experience as a waiter/waitress or in customer-facing roles in hospitality
	Excellent verbal communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to multitask and work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
	Professional appearance and strong customer service mindset
	Basic knowledge of food and beverages is a plus
	Team player, punctual, and dependable
	Flexible with shifts, including evenings, weekends, and holidays


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 Monthly.

Click here to apply online

 

2.) Accountant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Accountant will be responsible for managing the financial operations of Ora Lagos.
	This includes maintaining accurate records, preparing financial reports, handling payroll, ensuring tax compliance, managing cash flow, and supporting the overall financial health of the business.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate records of all financial transactions including income, expenses, sales, and payroll
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports and cash flow statements
	Monitor budgets and spending to ensure financial efficiency
	Process and manage payroll for all staff and ensure timely payment
	File statutory payments such as PAYE, VAT, pension, and other government obligations
	Work closely with management to provide insight on financial performance
	Recommend and implement cost-saving measures
	Handle daily reconciliations of POS, cash, and bank transactions
	Monitor inventory spending and supplier payments
	Support internal and external audit processes
	Maintain and organize accounting documents and records for future reference


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Accuracy and timeliness of financial reports
	Compliance with tax and statutory obligations
	Payroll accuracy and timeliness
	Budget adherence and cost control
	Efficiency in reconciliations and record keeping


Skills & Qualifications


	B.Sc./HND in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	Minimum of 2–3 years of hands-on accounting experience
	Proficiency in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, or similar tools
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
	High level of integrity and attention to detail
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
	Strong understanding of Nigerian tax laws and payroll regulations
	Ability to work independently and meet deadlines


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 Monthly.

Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Head Chef

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head Chef is responsible for leading kitchen operations, designing and preparing high-quality dishes, and maintaining exceptional food standards.
	This role involves managing the kitchen team, ensuring efficiency, and upholding health and safety regulations.
	The ideal candidate is a creative and skilled culinary professional with proven leadership experience in a dynamic kitchen environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Design and update menus to reflect current trends and customer preferences while maintaining the lounge’s brand identity.
	Ensure all menu items are prepared to the highest standards of quality and presentation.
	Manage recipe creation and standardization for consistency.
	Oversee daily kitchen activities to ensure smooth and efficient operations.
	Supervise food preparation and cooking processes to meet quality standards.
	Ensure proper maintenance of kitchen equipment and workspaces.
	Recruit, train, and mentor kitchen staff, including assistant chefs and kitchen assistants.
	Assign duties, monitor performance, and provide constructive feedback to team members.
	Collaborate with vendors to ensure timely delivery of quality ingredients.
	Ensure the kitchen operates in compliance with health, safety, and hygiene regulations.
	Foster a collaborative and positive working environment within the kitchen.
	Monitor stock levels and order supplies as needed to avoid shortages or waste.
	Manage kitchen budgets by controlling food costs and minimizing waste.
	Implement and enforce strict food safety standards.
	Conduct regular inspections to ensure cleanliness and organization.


Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)


	Quality and consistency of dishes served.
	Effective cost control and minimal food wastage.
	Staff performance and team morale.
	Customer satisfaction and positive feedback.
	Adherence to health and safety regulations.


Requirements


	Proven experience as a Head Chef or similar role in a high-paced kitchen.
	Advanced culinary skills and proficiency in a variety of cooking techniques.
	Strong leadership and team management abilities.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Sound knowledge of food safety and sanitation standards.
	Creativity and a passion for delivering exceptional dining experiences.
	Availability to work flexible hours, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.


Salary
N200,000 - N300,000 per month.

Key Account Officer Job at iCentra




        
    

        
        iCentra - Founded in 2009, iCentra started operations in Abuja, Nigeria. We embarked on the journey to catalyze positive transformations within the business landscape with a steadfast mission to enhance both individual and organizational performance. We firmly believe in the creation of value not only for our clients but for all stakeholders involved. Since its inception, our company has tirelessly strived to partner with organizations across industries to deliver extraordinary results. Our unwavering commitment to excellence is reflected in our diverse range of expertise, spanning Business Consulting, Technology Solutions, Project Management, and Learning & Development.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Key Account Officer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary: 


	We are looking for a client focused and results driven Key Account Officer to support our business development, marketing, and sales functions. The successful candidate will serve as the primary point of contact for key clients, working to maintain strong relationships and identify opportunities for business growth through upselling, cross-selling, and account expansion. Familiarity with consulting, marketing strategy, and business development practices is highly desirable. 


Key Responsibilities


	Build and nurture long-term relationships with key stakeholders. 
	Understand client needs and propose relevant solutions or services to meet those needs. 
	Conduct market research and trend analysis to uncover emerging client needs and develop strategies to address them. 
	Lead and support the preparation of high-quality proposals, EOIs, concept notes, etc.   
	Support proposal and bid submissions as needed. 
	Track and report on account performance metrics and opportunities. 
	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients. 
	Build and maintain a healthy sales pipeline through networking, referrals, inbound leads, and outbound efforts 
	Identify and pursue opportunities for upselling and cross-selling across accounts. 
	Monitor client satisfaction and develop strategies to increase retention. 
	Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned accounts, ensuring client satisfaction and retention. 
	Track account performance and prepare regular reports on client engagement and revenue growth. 
	Support the development of marketing and sales strategies to attract and retain clients. 


Qualifications & Experience


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field. 
	 5 – 7 years of proven experience in?account management, business development, or B2B sales. 
	Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills. 
	Ability to understand client needs and translate them into actionable solutions. 
	Familiarity with CRM tools and sales performance metrics. 
	Proven ability to identify greenfield opportunities and close deals. 
	Strong proposal writing and bid development experience is essential. 
	Excellent interpersonal, negotiation communication, and client engagement skills. 
	Experience in a consulting, professional services, or solution-selling environment is a strong advantage. 


Method of Application
